Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched like a postseason ace, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings and sending the New York Yankees to a 3-1 victory
The New York bullpen dominated a tense AL Division Series, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 and two-thirds innings this postseason
A near-fracas nearly ignited Kansas City after a hard tag was slapped on Maikel Garcia at second base by Yankees third baseman Jazz Chisholm Jr
Cole got Salvador Perez to pop out lazily to second base to end the inning
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
The Yankees manager Aaron Boone said they get to go play for it now and they’re excited about that
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team’s resilience after the comeback win

The Royals manager Matt Quatraro said he feels really badly for those guys in the room, because as you know, this is seven, eight months of the year that they just pour it all into it, and give every ounce of effort and energy they have
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees won 50 games away from home in the regular season, their most in 21 years
Kansas City did not win a home game after 8 September, losing nine in a row including the playoffs
The Royals went from 106-loss laughingstock a year ago to making its first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series
